newsitem.title: USA: Software 2000 sees Q4 below expectations.
newsitem.headline: Software 2000 sees Q4 below expectations.

text.p: Software 2000 Inc said on Tuesday that its fourth quarter results are expected to be below expectations at $20.6 million in sales and earnings per share of $0.21.

Software 2000, which held an initial public offering in November, was expected to earn $0.30 a share for the fourth quarter ended September 30, 1996, according to First Call's consensus of analysts' forecasts.
Software 2000 expects fiscal year revenues of $71 million, compared with $63 million in the year ago period.
Software 2000 said net income for the fiscal year ended September 30, 1996 to total $5.6 million, versus $3.7 million in the prior year.
Earnings per share are estimated to be $0.49 for the fiscal year, an increase from $0.40 in fiscal 1995, the company said.
In last year's fourth quarter, the company posted $0.24 a share in profits.
"We had a good quarter, but our software license and consulting revenues fell short of expectations," chief executive Robert Pemberton said in a statement.
